verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,
Command the children of Israel , that they put out of the camp every leper , and every one that hath an issue , and whosoever is defiled by the dead :
Both male and female shall ye put out , without the camp shall ye put them; that they defile not their camps , in the midst whereof I dwell.
And the children of Israel did so , and put them out without the camp : as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , so did the children of Israel. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,
Speak unto the children of Israel , When a man or woman shall commit any sin that men commit , to do a trespass against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and that person be guilty ;

Then they shall confess their sin which they have done : and he shall recompense his trespass with the principal thereof, and add unto it the fifth \add part\add* thereof, and give \add it\add* unto \add him\add* against whom he hath trespassed.

But if the man have no kinsman to recompense the trespass unto, let the trespass be recompensed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add even\add* to the priest ; beside the ram of the atonement , whereby an atonement shall be made for him.
And every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel , which they bring unto the priest , shall be his.\f + \fr 5.9 \ft offering: or, heave offering\f*
And every man’s hallowed things shall be his: whatsoever any man giveth the priest , it shall be his. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,
Speak unto the children of Israel , and say unto them, If any man’s wife go aside , and commit a trespass against him,

And a man lie with her carnally , and it be hid from the eyes of her husband , and be kept close , and she be defiled , and \add there be\add* no witness against her, neither she be taken \add with the manner;\add*
And the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife , and she be defiled : or if the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife , and she be not defiled :

Then shall the man bring his wife unto the priest , and he shall bring her offering for her, the tenth \add part\add* of an ephah of barley meal ; he shall pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon; for it \add is\add* an offering of jealousy , an offering of memorial , bringing iniquity to remembrance.
And the priest shall bring her near , and set her before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*:
And the priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel ; and of the dust that is in the floor of the tabernacle the priest shall take , and put \add it\add* into the water :

And the priest shall set the woman before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and uncover the woman’s head , and put the offering of memorial in her hands , which \add is\add* the jealousy offering : and the priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that causeth the curse :

And the priest shall charge her by an oath , and say unto the woman , If no man have lain with thee, and if thou hast not gone aside to uncleanness \add with another\add* instead of thy husband , be thou free from this bitter water that causeth the curse :\f + \fr 5.19 \ft with another…: or, being in the power of thy husband: Heb. under thy husband\f*
But if thou hast gone aside \add to another\add* instead of thy husband , and if thou be defiled , and some man have lain with thee beside thine husband :

Then the priest shall charge the woman with an oath of cursing , and the priest shall say unto the woman , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* make thee a curse and an oath among thy people , when the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* doth make thy thigh to rot , and thy belly to swell ;  +  r 5.21  t rot: Heb. fall *
And this water that causeth the curse shall go into thy bowels , to make \add thy\add* belly to swell , and \add thy\add* thigh to rot : And the woman shall say , Amen , amen.
And the priest shall write these curses in a book , and he shall blot \add them\add* out with the bitter water :
And he shall cause the woman to drink the bitter water that causeth the curse : and the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, \add and become\add* bitter.
Then the priest shall take the jealousy offering out of the woman’s hand , and shall wave the offering before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and offer it upon the altar :
And the priest shall take an handful of the offering , \add even\add* the memorial thereof, and burn \add it\add* upon the altar , and afterward shall cause the woman to drink the water.

And when he hath made her to drink the water , then it shall come to pass, \add that\add*, if she be defiled , and have done trespass against her husband , that the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, \add and become\add* bitter , and her belly shall swell , and her thigh shall rot : and the woman shall be a curse among her people.
And if the woman be not defiled , but be clean ; then she shall be free , and shall conceive seed.
This \add is\add* the law of jealousies , when a wife goeth aside \add to another\add* instead of her husband , and is defiled ;

Or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon him , and he be jealous over his wife , and shall set the woman before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the priest shall execute upon her all this law.
Then shall the man be guiltless from iniquity , and this woman shall bear her iniquity.
